result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devontae R. Smith

records.addlTxt:
9:21 AM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Devontae R. Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Kristyne Watson in court for Devontae R. Smith. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Both parties are requesting an adjournment. Attorney Watson advises the Court that the DE has a pending revocation and still needs to review electronic discovery. Also the substances have still not been tested. Court adjourns.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

08:59 AM   Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State. Defendant, Devontae R. Smith, appeared in custody with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.   No drug paraphenalia.

01:13 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant is on a PO Hold.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on August 26, 2022 at 09:15 am. $2500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
